content:
It's possible to complete all test / validators using character counts only, which is obviously not intended (I can send code if you want it). I suggest adding a new test to block that approach.

Example:
7
abdcefg
3
agc
Wrong approach provides Alternative, correct approach provides Missing.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The puzzle is interresting and solvable.
It reminds me of one of my school's tests. Very interesting!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: cool z

Binary output issue
* According to the contribution guidelines, binary output should be avoided for clashes. As your clash accepts only two possible answers (either "Yes" or "No"), it suffers from the binary output issue. Please change the output requirement so that there are more than two possible answers in total.

Input
* Please change "First line contains", "Second line contains", etc. to "<<Line 1>>:", "<<Line 2>>:", etc. In other words, please add line numbers in the above format for all four lines.

Output
* Please format "Yes" and "No" as {{constants}} and remove the quotation marks.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement, e.g. "write answer".

Thanks.

Input
* Please change "n (10 <= n <= 100)" to "integer [[n]]".

* Please delete "(2 <= m <= 20)".

* Line 2: Please change "string" to "string [[availableParts]]".

* Line 4: Please change "s string" to "string [[brokenPart]]".

Thanks.
